Psoriasis.description: Psoriasis is a chronic autoimmune condition that causes rapid buildup of skin cells, resulting in scaling on the skin's surface.
symptoms: Red patches of skin covered with silvery scales
Small scaling spots (commonly seen in children)
Dry, cracked skin that may bleed
causes: Immune system dysfunction where T cells attack healthy skin cells
Environmental triggers like stress, injuries, and certain medications
treatment: Topical treatments: Corticosteroids, vitamin D analogues, retinoids
Lifestyle changes: Regular moisturizing, stress reduction, healthy diet
Psoriasis.when_to_see_doctor: Consult a doctor if you suspect you have psoriasis or if your symptoms worsen despite treatment.

Dengue.description: Dengue is a mosquito-borne viral infection causing flu-like symptoms and, in severe cases, potentially life-threatening complications.
causes: Infection by the dengue virus (DENV), transmitted by Aedes mosquitoes
risk_factors: Living or traveling in tropical/subtropical areas
treatment: Avoiding NSAIDs like ibuprofen and aspirin
Dengue.when_to_see_doctor: Seek medical help if high fever lasts more than 2 days, or if there are warning signs like bleeding, vomiting, or severe abdominal pain.

Common Cold.description: The common cold is a viral infection of the upper respiratory tract, including the nose and throat.
symptoms: Slight body aches or a mild headache
treatment: Decongestants and antihistamines for symptom relief
Throat lozenges and saline nasal drops
Common Cold.when_to_see_doctor: See a doctor if symptoms last more than 10 days, are severe or unusual, or if you have a fever higher than 101.3Â°F (38.5Â°C).

Dimorphic Hemorrhoids.description: Dimorphic hemorrhoids refer to a condition where both internal and external hemorrhoids are present, causing significant discomfort and bleeding.
symptoms: Swelling or lumps around the anus
Itching or irritation in the anal region
treatment: High-fiber diet and increased fluid intake
Minimally invasive procedures (rubber band ligation, sclerotherapy)
Dimorphic Hemorrhoids.when_to_see_doctor: Consult a doctor if you experience rectal bleeding, severe pain, or if symptoms persist despite home treatments.

Arthritis.description: Arthritis refers to inflammation of one or more joints, causing pain and stiffness that can worsen with age.
causes: Osteoarthritis due to wear and tear
risk_factors: Gender (some types are more common in women)
Arthritis.when_to_see_doctor: Consult a doctor if joint pain persists, worsens, or interferes with daily function.

Acne.description: Acne is a skin condition that occurs when hair follicles become clogged with oil and dead skin cells.
symptoms: Large, painful lumps under the skin
risk_factors: Hormonal changes during puberty or menstruation
Diet (high in sugars or dairy for some people)
treatment: Topical treatments: benzoyl peroxide, salicylic acid, retinoids
Proper skin hygiene and non-comedogenic products
Acne.when_to_see_doctor: See a dermatologist if acne is severe, painful, or causing emotional distress or scarring.

Bronchial Asthma.description: Bronchial asthma is a chronic inflammatory disease of the airways that causes recurrent breathing problems.
symptoms: Coughing, especially at night or early morning
risk_factors: Family history of asthma or allergies
Bronchial Asthma.when_to_see_doctor: Seek medical attention if symptoms worsen, affect daily activities, or require frequent use of quick-relief inhalers.

Hypertension.description: Hypertension, or high blood pressure, is a common condition where the long-term force of blood against artery walls is high enough to eventually cause health problems.
symptoms: Most people have no symptoms, hence it's called the 'silent killer'
Very high blood pressure might cause headaches
causes: Primary hypertension: Develops gradually with no identifiable cause
Secondary hypertension: Caused by underlying conditions like kidney disease, sleep apnea, thyroid problems
treatment: Lifestyle changes: Regular exercise, healthy diet, limiting sodium and alcohol
Medications: Diuretics, ACE inhibitors, ARBs, calcium channel blockers
Hypertension.when_to_see_doctor: Regular blood pressure checks are important. See a doctor immediately if blood pressure is extremely high or if you have symptoms like severe headache, blurred vision, or nosebleeds.

Migraine.description: Migraine is a neurological condition that can cause multiple symptoms, commonly characterized by intense, debilitating headaches.
symptoms: Throbbing or pulsing headache, often on one side of the head
Sensitivity to light, sounds, and sometimes smells and touch
Aura (visual phenomena like flashes of light)
causes: Abnormal brain activity affecting nerve signals, chemicals, and blood vessels
risk_factors: Gender (women are three times more likely to have migraines)
treatment: Pain-relieving medications: Over-the-counter or prescription pain relievers
Preventive medications: Cardiovascular drugs, antidepressants, anti-seizure drugs
Lifestyle changes: Regular sleep, meals, exercise, and stress management
Alternative therapies: Acupuncture, biofeedback, cognitive behavioral therapy
Migraine.when_to_see_doctor: Consult a doctor if pattern or symptoms of your headaches change, if treatments don't help, or if they're disabling.

Chicken Pox.description: Chickenpox is a highly contagious viral infection causing an itchy, blister-like rash, usually in children.
symptoms: Itchy rash that turns into fluid-filled blisters and then scabs
treatment: Antiviral medications (like acyclovir in severe cases)
Keeping fingernails trimmed to prevent skin infections
Chicken Pox.when_to_see_doctor: See a doctor if the rash spreads to the eyes, becomes very red or tender, or if symptoms are severe or last longer than expected.

Cervical Spondylosis.description: Cervical spondylosis is age-related wear and tear affecting the spinal disks in your neck.
symptoms: Weakness or numbness in arms, hands, or legs
Difficulty with coordination or walking (in severe cases)
causes: Aging and degeneration of spinal discs
treatment: Surgery in severe or progressive cases
Cervical Spondylosis.when_to_see_doctor: Seek medical attention if you have chronic neck pain, or symptoms affecting limbs or coordination.

Allergy.description: An allergy is an immune system reaction to a foreign substance that's not typically harmful to your body, such as pollen, pet dander, or certain foods.
symptoms: Swelling of lips, tongue, or throat
risk_factors: Family history of allergies or asthma
Having other allergic conditions like eczema
Allergy.when_to_see_doctor: See a doctor if your symptoms are persistent, severe, or interfere with daily life. Seek immediate care for signs of anaphylaxis.

Gastroesophageal Reflux Disease.description: GERD is a chronic digestive disorder where stomach acid or bile flows back into the esophagus, irritating its lining.
symptoms: Regurgitation of food or sour liquid
causes: Weak or relaxed lower esophageal sphincter
risk_factors: Certain medications (e.g., NSAIDs, calcium channel blockers)
Diet high in fatty or spicy foods
treatment: Lifestyle changes: avoiding trigger foods, eating smaller meals
Gastroesophageal Reflux Disease.when_to_see_doctor: Consult a doctor if symptoms occur more than twice a week or interfere with your daily life.

Drug Reaction.description: A drug reaction is an unwanted or unexpected response to a medication, which may be mild or severe.
symptoms: Swelling of lips, tongue, or face
causes: Toxic effects from overdoses or incorrect use
Immune system response to certain drugs
Drug Reaction.when_to_see_doctor: Seek immediate medical attention if you have signs of a serious reaction, especially breathing difficulty or facial swelling.

Diabetes.description: Diabetes is a group of diseases that affect how your body uses blood sugar (glucose).
causes: Type 1: Immune system attacking insulin-producing cells
Type 2: Cells becoming resistant to insulin action
Diabetes.when_to_see_doctor: See a doctor if you notice any diabetes symptoms or if you have risk factors for diabetes.
